Posts.Content: Nov 7, 2007 09:01PM macs wrote: Hi Kasey, I had Xeloda last year with HFS and really bad diarrhea.  I even lost control at work one day as I tried to get to the bathroom.  Ugh.  My doc cut my dose back so things settled down a bit and there was no increase in the cancer.  My numbers kept falling even at the lower doses. Now I'm on Gemzar but only had one treatment after which my blood cell count bottomed out.  I'm on a one month chemo vacation now but my cancer count keeps on going down. I guess what I'm trying to say is that the chemo is a poison, not only for the cancer but for the whole body.  If your doc thinks it's time to be off, he/she is probably right and trying to watch out for the whole you, not just the cancer.   I hope you find relief from the symptoms and the worry. Diane
Posts.Title: Called the Onc... Kasey AliceJean

Posts.Content: Jul 14, 2008 11:28AM macs wrote: Dear Amber,  What terrible choices we have to make.  I can't imagine doing this with 5 kids!  It's been hard enough with one.  To give you hope, I've had mets since 1997.  While it hasn't been easy, while I've broken my leg twice because of the bone mets, I'm still here, working part time, hoping I'll see my son married....I was diagnosed at his confirmation and now he's heading toward PhD graduation.  The years roll on with new treatments. My onc put me on abraxane rather than taxol because it was supposed to be easier on my system.  However after three treatments my feet were numb up to my ankle and my fingertips were also numb.  My doc was surprised to see the reaction coming so quickly.  We're all so different that it's amost impossible to predict what will happen, thus the problems for the docs. I hope you will make it through your vacation as planned.  But if not, you will still make it through.  And your family will be there for you.  And this will not be your last vacation.  I'm working on hiking Colorado trails again this fall for the first time in three years!  Hope reigns. Diane
Posts.Title: Progression for me :o( What to do, what to do???? mrs_X_Sunneedazee Barb-FightingBC

Posts.Content: Jul 13, 2008 11:07PM macs wrote: Hey,  I was diagnosed with liver mets last August.  In Februray I had a new treatment called SIRTEX, microscopic spheres with radiation bonded to them that were infused directly into my liver via my femeral artery.  I'm now cancer free in my liver.  It's not a cure, but has bought me a bunch more time....with the possibility of have this treatment again. Good luck and blessings, Diane
Posts.Title: Some help and advice w/met to liver controlmydestiny controlmydestiny

Posts.Content: Sep 30, 2007 02:32AM - edited Sep 30, 2007 02:32AM by macs Dear River, I was diagnosed with bc in 1993, had mastectomy, Adrio/Cytox chemo (I'm one of those old timers who spent three days hanging over the toilet after each treatment), and radiation.  In 1997 I was diagnosed with bone mets.  Since then I have been on Tamoxifen, Aromasin, Fermara, Faslodex, massive doses of Estrodial, Zometa, Xeloda, and in July was diagnosed with liver mets and am now on abraxane and avastin.  I've had two radiation rounds on my legs but mets elsewhere became inactive after hormonal treatment.       I normally have a bit of discomfort in the bones where the cancer is becoming active enough for treatment so in that way I'm lucky.  I catch it early in the process.  The bone mets in my femurs have led to other issues but I won't go into that now.  Just know that I'm 10 years with bone mets and counting.   Hang in there, Diane
Posts.Title: bone mets survivors riverinerabbit mom2acat

Posts.Content: Apr 10, 2008 11:22PM macs wrote: Hi Watson, I have read the MDAnderson posts and hope you are getting some satisfaction from them or at least have found another onc for a second opinion.   When I read the subject line of this conversation I was reminded of my Xeloda experience and thought you could use a laugh.  I was on the drugs, can't even remember now what dosage, but I remember being one two weeks and off two weeks.  I was tired for two weeks out of every month and was also walking with crutches for a fractured leg. Turns out the Xeloda did more than hand/foot sydrome and fatigue to me.  I was also hit with explosive bouts of diarrhea.  One day I was talking with a student, female luckily, and finally jumped up and said I would be back.  Before I even made it across the hall into the bathroom, the crap was running down my leg.  The dear student ran to her apartment and brought me a pair of sweats I could put on after I cleaned up.  And then I went home, mortified, but able to laugh. So two things.  Xeloda is indeed CRAP.  And don't take it when you're on crutches.  Diarrhea and crutches don't mix. Keep the faith, Diane
Posts.Title: Xeloda Crappola Watson Watson

Posts.Content: Apr 11, 2008 02:31AM macs wrote: Hi Bonnie, I was on Abraxane and Avastin for only three cycles every three weeks before the doc pulled me off because of neuropathy.  My feet and finger tips are numb.  I tried Lyrica and it helped relieve the neuropathy a bit but it interfered with the Tamoxifen I was put on last month so had to let it go.  The numbness is a bit into my ankles too.  Keep watch on it since it can continue to creep up your legs.  My doc was so surprised I ended up with the neuropathy so soon and so badly.  I don't think it's the normal way. The doc put me on Gemzar after that but my blood count bottomed out so I never had it again.  Instead I had embolization to my liver that had basically no side effects.  But I'm still struggling with the neuropathy.  I have a rod in my femur for a break so I'm very careful about walking.  I will be seeing an occupational therapist soon so I can learn how to get around with this numbness.  I am refusing to trip and fall a third time.  I really like my orthopedic surgeon but not enough to break my leg a third time. Good luck, Diane
Posts.Title: How long on Abraxane? BonnieVA lv2cmp

Posts.Content: Apr 11, 2008 01:51AM macs wrote: I'm sorry for this loss, Joni.  Your oncology trips will be lonlier without her. Diane
Posts.Title: Sherri Kirk - Another Angel jonimb ozzie2

Posts.Content: Oct 4, 2007 04:44AM - edited Oct 4, 2007 04:44AM by macs Jill,  I'm on abraxane and avastin right now.  Just finished my third cycle.  This is my third chemo and the easiest regarding side effects.  I'm fatigued for a week, then back to work.  I'm plagued with peripheral neuropathy which is more of an irritation than anything that slows me down.  My appetite is not as good as it was.  My husband "force feeds" me ice cream every night to be sure I don't lose too much weight.  What a guy.  I also have aches and pains that lessen after a week off the chemo.  The avastin is causing some high blood pressure that I'm monitoring.  I was given dex with my first cycle and was really sick from that, severe headache, vomiting, and unable to eat for three days.  That went away when they stopped giving it to me. I would not hesitate to go with the abraxane.  It's not bonded with "draino" the way others are so is much easier on the system.   Wendy, I loved your message when your brain blanked out.  Chemo brain has also been a side effect of the abraxane.  Your, oh crap, is so familiar and honest..... Hang in Jill. Diane
Posts.Title: Abraxane, anyone on it? Kelownagirl Kelownagirl

Posts.Content: Mar 17, 2008 04:56PM macs wrote: I've not been on Herceptin but was on Gemzar.  I was supposed to get it weekly, had a port put in after one treatment because it was a pretty painful infusion.  When I went back the second week for the treatment, the doc didn't give it to me because my blood counts had bottomed out.  I had two units of blood but the counts didn't come up enough to have another treatment.  So they switched me to SIRTEX, an internal radiation treatment directly to the liver.  No side effects while I was having it, but am now plagued with constant low grade fever and anemia.  Seems that any treatment we have causes other problems..... Diane
Posts.Title: Failed Herceptin now onto Gemzar tracey2424 macs

Posts.Content: Oct 22, 2007 11:04PM macs wrote: Hey Tracy, Thanks for suggesting the liver mets thread.  I was diagnosed with liver mets in late July 07 and started abraxane and avastin in August, three weeks between treatments.  I haven't had a second CT with contrast since beginning the treatment but my CA 15-3 is coming down so I'm happy about that.  But I'm no longer on the abraxane and avastin.  Last week I went in for my fourth treatment and my doc freaked out about the peripheral neuropathy I was experiencing.  My fingers are numb and my total feet and up my ankles are numb.  Doc said she was surprised at how badly it had effected me so quickly. Instead she started me on small weekly doses of Gemzar and carboplatin.  This week I'm going to get a port for the first time in the fourteen years I've been dealing with this disease.  That Gemzar hurts going in so badly, stings like a nest of hornets.  But I was back to work quicker than with the other drugs. I'm taking Gabapentin for pain at night that helps me sleep, although you wouldn't know it from the time of this post. Previous drugs for bone mets have been tamoxifen, aromisin, femara, faslodex, mega doses of estrodial (what a trip that was going back to puberty), aromasin again, then to Xeloda.  I was off Xeloda for 10 months, recovered from my second titanium rod insert in my femur, was feeling good for the first time in two years, when I was diagnosed with the liver mets.   Tracy, it's so hard to keep on fighting, but we'll do it. Blessings, Diane
Posts.Title: thread on liver mets? Tracy1964 LuAnnH
